title: Cooling Labor Market and Elevated Inflation Stoke Fed Divisions on Rate Cuts
summary: Fed officials explained their opposition to the central bank’s decision this week to cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point.

title: Rob Reiner Gave Us Great Reasons to Go to the Movies
summary: “This Is Spinal Tap,” “When Harry Met Sally …,” “Misery”: Reiner delivered an incredible number of accessible, original and adult movies that we still cherish.

title: Obamas Had Plans to See the Reiners the Day They Were Found Dead
summary: Michelle Obama said on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” that she and former President Barack Obama were longtime friends of the couple and called them “decent, courageous” people.

title: Venezuela’s Oil Is a Focus of Trump’s Campaign Against Maduro
summary: In public, the White House says it is confronting Venezuela to curb drug trafficking. Behind the scenes, gaining access to the country’s vast oil reserves is a priority.

title: Trinidad and Tobago Sides With U.S. in Battle Against Venezuela, Military Tool Suggests
summary: The United States and Trinidad say U.S. Marines installed a radar in Tobago to combat drugs — but this war materiel isn’t designed for operations based at sea or on land.

title: The Untold Story of How Jeffrey Epstein Got Rich
summary: For years, rumors swirled about where his wealth came from. A Times investigation reveals the truth of how a college dropout clawed his way to the pinnacle of American finance and society.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein Made His Money: Six Takeaways From The Times’ Investigation
summary: The sources of Epstein’s fortune have long been a source of speculation. Here are six takeaways from a Times investigation that found that he built it through scams, theft and lies.

title: Who Is the Ultimate Onscreen Mr. Darcy From ‘Pride and Prejudice’?
summary: Welcome to our Regency Thunderdome, where we will endeavor to answer this question once and for all.

title: Brown Shooting Tests a Fragile Trust on Campus
summary: The Ivy League school has faced a series of challenges related to protests and politics. Through it all, it has kept its gates open to the city and tried to heal divisions on campus.

title: Brown Shooter Still at Large After Nearly Three Days
summary: The authorities are still looking for the gunman who killed two students at Brown University. Investigators are expected to release more video footage on Tuesday.

title: Days After Brown University Shooting, a Community Is in a Standstill
summary: As a manhunt for a gunman who killed two and injured nine at Brown University stretched into a third day, residents and officials alike were growing weary.

title: Watching ‘Liberation’ With a Women’s Movement Pioneer, My Mom
summary: In researching her new Broadway play, Bess Wohl interviewed my mother. After a performance, we all discussed the play and its themes.

title: Australia Doubles Down on Gun Control in Wake of Bondi Beach Shooting
summary: The country has long looked warily at the cycle of gun violence in the United States, where meaningful changes in policy have been rare.

title: Hospitals Cater to ‘Transplant Tourists’ as U.S. Patients Wait for Organs
summary: International patients can bring a hospital as much as $2 million for a transplant. In recent years, they have typically gotten organs faster than U.S. patients.

title: A Push for More Organ Transplants Is Putting Donors at Risk
summary: People across the United States have endured rushed or premature attempts to remove their organs. Some were gasping, crying or showing other signs of life.

title: Zelensky Expresses Wary Optimism About Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan
summary: Two days of talks between President Volodymyr Zelensky and allies have brought some progress on security guarantees, but Russia remains opposed to any foreign forces in Ukraine.

title: This Week Is Pivotal for Ukraine, and for Europe’s Voice in Its Future
summary: Often left out by the United States in peace negotiations, European countries are working to assert their leadership and bolster Ukraine with an ambitious funding plan. But can they agree?

title: Ukraine Says It Hit a Submarine With Underwater Drones
summary: As it tried to demonstrate its continuing ability to fight, Ukraine said it had used drones to inflict serious damage on a Russian Kilo-class submarine at a Black Sea port.

title: Europe May Roll Back Combustion Engine Ban
summary: A proposal to revise an E.U. law requiring carmakers to stop producing combustion engines by 2035 would offer some relief to automakers, but it sets back the region’s climate goals.

title: Volkswagen to End Production at German Plant, a First in Company History
summary: The auto giant stopped making cars at the plant in Dresden, which opened in 2001, as it faces weaker demand and steep U.S. tariffs.

title: Arctic Report Card Marks Record Temperatures and Rainfall in Arctic
summary: A yearly checkup on the region documents a warmer, rainier Arctic and 200 Alaskan rivers “rusting” as melting tundra leaches minerals from the soil into waterways.

title: Stephen King on Rob Reiner’s ‘Stand by Me’
summary: In Rob’s hands, “Stand by Me,” my most autobiographical novel, rang true.

title: Donate This Holiday Season: The World’s Poorest Need Your Help
summary: Elie Hassenfeld, the chief executive of the nonprofit GiveWell, makes the case for a more rigorous, transparent and accountable approach to charitable giving.

title: A Look at Australia’s Gun Laws
summary: We examine how the country responds to mass shootings.

title: Man Who Plowed Car Into Liverpool F.C. Parade Is Sentenced to 21 Years
summary: Paul Doyle was sentenced to more than 21 years on Tuesday after he struck about 130 people leaving a victory parade for Liverpool F.C.

title: Ranchers in South Dakota Turn to Prescribed Burns to Treat Their Land
summary: A “green glacier” of trees is steadily taking over native grasslands. Landowners are banding together to treat the problem with fire.

title: 10-Year-Old Killed in Russia School Stabbing
summary: The attack appeared to have been inspired by white supremacist ideology, Telegram channels close to intelligence agencies reported.

title: Uber and DoorDash Try to Halt N.Y.C. Law That Encourages Tipping
summary: The two food-delivery app companies filed a lawsuit against new rules, starting in January, that require food-delivery apps  to provide a tipping option at checkout.

title: Netflix Adds Podcasts in Deal With iHeartMedia
summary: The streaming service now has about 30 video podcasts lined up for 2026, including the influential radio show “The Breakfast Club.”
